column4: okay so I can't seem to get my new 8.04 server to allow x11 forwarding. I've added the host using xhost at the client end and added x11 forwarding to the ssh_config file. Is there anything else I should be doing to get $DISPLAY set?
do you get any interesting information when you increase the debugging? i.e. ssh -vvv -X ip-address
sorry for the delay. Got a phone book
and when you try to run something? .. e.g. xclock
more debug info, just the can't open display, display not set
i'm sorry
no more debug info
hmm .. I assume you restarted the ssh server after changing the config?
yes. though I just noticed something in that connect...Remote: No xauth program; cannot forward with spoofing
noticed something in the debug on connect I mean
interesting ..  have you got xauth installed?
on the machine (a mac) I'm connecting from, yes
and on the machine you're connecting to?
no, did I need it?
it's definitely installed on mine .. and when I connect $DISPLAY is set to localhost:10.0
I'm used to doing the giant bag of crap install on previous servers.I guess I got that whole client vs. server dichotomy reversed again
beautiful. Thanks
is it working?
yup
yay!
thanks. Now I have to do all that fun new server stuff like reconfigure emacs and whatnot
nice! have fun!
